title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Commits allowed Claude Code attribution, Co-Authored-trailers, emojis Write normal commit messages human wrote

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs merged CI passes. Run checks locally opening PR:

title: Claude Code Instructions
code: # R package check (required) devtools::check()  # Python tests (required) system("pip install -e ./pyidschooldata && pytest tests/test_pyidschooldata.py -v")  # pkgdown build (required) pkgdown::build_site()

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: opening PR, verify: - [ ] devtools::check() — 0 errors, 0 warnings - [ ] pytest tests/test_pyidschooldata.py — tests pass - [ ] pkgdown::build_site() — builds without errors - [ ] Vignettes render (eval=FALSE hacks)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Historical Enrollment District/Charter (WORKING) - URL: https://www.sde.idaho.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/Historical-Enrollment--District--Charter.xlsx - Size: ~500KB - Format: Excel (xlsx) - Years: 1995-1996 2025-2026 - Contents: District/charter enrollment grade level - Structure: - Skip 4 header rows - Column 1 (#): District ID number - Column 2 (School District Charter School): Entity name (fill-format) - Column 3 (Year): School year format “YYYY-YYYY” (e.g., “2024-2025”) - Column 4 (Membership): Total enrollment - Columns 5-18: Grade-level enrollment (Preschool, K, 1st-12th)

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URL: https://www.sde.idaho.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/Historical-Enrollment--Building-1.xlsx Size: ~6MB Building-level enrollment data URL: https://www.sde.idaho.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/Enrollment--District--Charter-School.xlsx Latest year URL: https://www.sde.idaho.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/Historical-State-Enrollment--Grade.xlsx Statewide totals grade

what: Known Broken URLs (404 as of January 2026)
title: Claude Code Instructions
text: following old URL patterns longer work: - https://www.sde.idaho.gov/finance/files/attendance-enrollment/historical/* - https://www.sde.idaho.gov/finance/files/attendance-enrollment/enrollment/*

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: URLs break , check: 1. Finance portal: https://www.sde.idaho.gov/finance/ 2. Look “Attendance Enrollment” section 3. Files now /wp-content/uploads/YYYY/MM/ format

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Year format: “YYYY-YYYY” (e.g., “2024-2025”) Fill-format: District names appear first row per entity State totals: First block rows contains “STATE IDAHO - TOTALS” ~190+ districts/charters per year Total state enrollment: ~310,000-320,000 students

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Race/ethnicity data included main enrollment file. Available : - Idaho Report Card: https://idahoreportcard.org/

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER push directly main. changes must go PRs auto-merge:
code: # 1. Create feature branch git checkout -b fix/description-of-change  # 2. Make changes, commit git add -A git commit -m "Fix: description of change"  # 3. Push and create PR with auto-merge git push -u origin fix/description-of-change gh pr create --title "Fix: description" --body "Description of changes" gh pr merge --auto --squash  # 4. Clean up stale branches after PR merges git checkout main && git pull && git fetch --prune origin

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: Clean stale branches every time touch package:
code: # Delete local branches merged to main git branch --merged main | grep -v main | xargs -r git branch -d  # Prune remote tracking branches git fetch --prune origin

title: Claude Code Instructions
text: PRs auto-merge CI checks pass: - R-CMD-check (0 errors, 0 warnings) - Python tests (py{st}schooldata exists) - pkgdown build (vignettes must render) CI fails, fix issue push - auto-merge triggers checks pass.

what: 1. Idaho is the fastest-growing state for schools
title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: Idaho added 70,000 students since 2010, 25% increase. Tech workers fleeing California families seeking affordability reshaping state.
code: state_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment")  ggplot(state_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Idaho Public School Enrollment",        subtitle = "Fastest-growing state: +70,000 students since 2010",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 2. West Ada (Meridian) is Idaho’s school giant
title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: West Ada School District suburban Boise serves 40,000 students, double district. grows 1,000+ students per year.
code: enr_current %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   select(district_name, n_students) %>%   head(10) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, n_students)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = district_label, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   coord_flip() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Idaho's Largest School Districts",        subtitle = "West Ada serves more than double any other district",        x = "", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: Hispanic students went 12% 20% enrollment since 2005. Treasure Valley Magic Valley regions transforming.  Twin Falls Caldwell school districts now 40% Hispanic.
code: hispanic <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "hispanic")  ggplot(hispanic, aes(x = end_year, y = pct * 100)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["hispanic"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["hispanic"]) +   labs(title = "Hispanic Student Population in Idaho",        subtitle = "From 12% to 20% since 2005",        x = "School Year", y = "Percent of Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: states lost students COVID, Idaho’s enrollment dipped briefly resuming growth. Families moved Idaho pandemic.
code: covid_years <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment",          end_year %in% 2019:max_year)  ggplot(covid_years, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_vline(xintercept = 2020, linetype = "dashed", color = "red", alpha = 0.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "Idaho Barely Slowed During COVID",        subtitle = "Brief dip before resuming rapid growth",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: Idaho’s kindergarten class keeps growing, unlike states ’s shrinking. Young families moving faster ’re moving .
code: k_trend <- enr_recent %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K")  ggplot(k_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Idaho Kindergarten Enrollment",        subtitle = "Record highs as young families move in",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: Idaho 60 charter schools serving 30,000 students. Charter growth explosive, especially Treasure Valley.
code: charter <- enr_current %>%   filter(grepl("Charter|Academy", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment")  charter_total <- sum(charter$n_students, na.rm = TRUE) state_total <- enr_current %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "total_enrollment") %>%   pull(n_students)  charter %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   mutate(district_label = reorder(district_name, n_students)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = district_label, y = n_students)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["asian"]) +   coord_flip() +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Idaho's Largest Charter Schools",        subtitle = paste0("Over ", format(charter_total, big.mark = ","),                         " students in charters (",                         round(charter_total / state_total * 100, 1), "% of state)"),        x = "", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: Boise suburbs boom, northern eastern Idaho districts shrinking. Wallace, Salmon, Challis half students 20 years ago.
code: rural <- c("Wallace Jt", "Salmon School", "Challis Jt") rural_trend <- enr %>%   filter(is_district,          grepl(paste(rural, collapse = "|"), district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(rural_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Rural Idaho is Emptying Out",        subtitle = "Wallace, Salmon, and Challis losing students",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: Idaho remains one whitest states, diversity increasing. Asian multiracial student populations growing fastest.
code: enr_current %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "hispanic", "asian", "multiracial",                          "black", "native_american", "pacific_islander")) %>%   mutate(subgroup_label = reorder(subgroup, pct)) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = subgroup_label, y = pct * 100)) +   geom_col(fill = colors["total"]) +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Idaho Student Demographics",        subtitle = "Still predominantly white, but diversifying",        x = "", y = "Percent of Students") +   theme_readme()

what: 9. The Treasure Valley is building schools constantly
title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: Eagle, Kuna, Star among fastest-growing areas America. New schools open every year, fill immediately.
code: treasure <- c("West Ada", "Kuna", "Middleton")  treasure_trend <- enr_recent %>%   filter(is_district,          grepl(paste(treasure, collapse = "|"), district_name, ignore.case = TRUE),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  ggplot(treasure_trend, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students, color = district_name)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.2) +   geom_point(size = 2.5) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma) +   labs(title = "Treasure Valley Growth",        subtitle = "West Ada, Kuna, and Middleton building schools constantly",        x = "School Year", y = "Students", color = "") +   theme_readme()

title: Idaho Enrollment Trends
text: Idaho’s ELL population grew 15,000 30,000 students since 2010. Agricultural communities refugee resettlement drive growth.
code: ell <- enr %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "lep")  ggplot(ell, aes(x = end_year, y = n_students)) +   geom_line(linewidth = 1.5, color = colors["total"]) +   geom_point(size = 3, color = colors["total"]) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = comma, limits = c(0, NA)) +   labs(title = "English Learners Have Doubled",        subtitle = "Agricultural communities and refugee resettlement drive growth",        x = "School Year", y = "Students") +   theme_readme()

title: Idaho School Data
text: Documentation | Getting Started | Enrollment Trends Fetch analyze Idaho school enrollment data Idaho State Department Education R Python.

what: What can you find with idschooldata?
title: Idaho School Data
text: 24 years enrollment data (2002-2025). 340,000 students today. 115 districts. ten stories hiding numbers - see Enrollment Trends vignette interactive visualizations: Idaho fastest-growing state schools - Added 70,000 students since 2010 West Ada (Meridian) Idaho’s school giant - 40,000 students, growing 1,000+/year Hispanic surge continues - 12% 20% since 2005 COVID barely slowed Idaho’s growth - Brief dip resuming rapid growth Kindergarten enrollment hit record highs - Young families moving Charter schools educate 1 12 students - 60+ charters serving 30,000 students Rural Idaho emptying - Wallace, Salmon, Challis shrinking 90% white, changing - Asian multiracial growing fastest Treasure Valley building schools constantly - West Ada, Kuna, Middleton English Learners doubled - 15,000 30,000 since 2010

title: Idaho School Data
code: library(idschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # Fetch all years with demographics (2011+) enr_demo <- fetch_enr_multi(2011:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics by district enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   group_by(district_name, subgroup) %>%   summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))

title: Idaho School Data
code: import pyidschooldata as id_  # Check available years years = id_.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year enr_2025 = id_.fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_recent = id_.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])  # State totals state_total = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_state'] == True) &     (enr_2025['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ]  # District breakdown districts = enr_2025[     (enr_2025['is_district'] == True) &     (enr_2025['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &     (enr_2025['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL') ].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)

title: Idaho School Data
text: Levels: State, district (~115), charter (~60), school Demographics: White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American, Pacific Islander, Multiracial Special populations: English Learners, Special Education Grade levels: Pre-K Grade 12

title: Idaho School Data
text: Idaho uses 3-digit district numbering system: - District ID: 3 digits (e.g., 001 Boise) - Charter IDs: 400+ series

Fetch Idaho enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Idaho State Department Education (SDE) public finance portal.

title: Fetch Idaho enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2002-2025, though demographic breakdowns available 2011 onward. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download SDE.

title: Fetch Idaho enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Idaho enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district (Boise) boise <- enr_2024 |>   dplyr::filter(district_id == "001") } # }

what: idschooldata: Fetch and Process Idaho School Data — idschooldata-package
title: idschooldata: Fetch and Process Idaho School Data — idschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Idaho State Department Education (SDE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data SDE's public finance portal transforming tidy format analysis.

title: idschooldata: Fetch and Process Idaho School Data — idschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations

title: idschooldata: Fetch and Process Idaho School Data — idschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: idschooldata: Fetch and Process Idaho School Data — idschooldata-package
text: Idaho uses unique identification system: District IDs: 3 digits (e.g., 001 = Boise Independent District) Building IDs: Varies source - typically district ID + building number

title: idschooldata: Fetch and Process Idaho School Data — idschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Idaho State Department Education: SDE Finance Portal: https://www.sde.idaho.gov/finance-transparency/public-school-finance/ Historical Enrollment: https://www.sde.idaho.gov/finance/files/attendance-enrollment/historical/

title: idschooldata: Fetch and Process Idaho School Data — idschooldata-package
text: Idaho enrollment data evolved time: Era 1 (2002-2010): Legacy format limited demographics Era 2 (2011-2024): Current format race/ethnicity breakdowns Note: Demographic data (race/ethnicity) available 2011 onward

title: idschooldata: Fetch and Process Idaho School Data — idschooldata-package
